title: Company News For Sep 11, 2019 - Nasdaq.com
text: HD Supply Holdings Inc.'s   HDS    shares tumbled 4.2% after reporting second-quarter 2019 revenues   of $1.62 billion, lagging the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.78   billion. The Wendy's Co.   WEN    plunged 10.2% after announcing its $20 million ambitious plan to   serve breakfast across the United States in 2020. McDonald's Corp.'s   MCD    shares tumbled 3.5% after announcing its plan to acquire a tech   startup Apprente to automate voice-based ordering in multiple   languages. Shares of Veoneer Inc.   VNE    jumped 6.2% after the company was selected by a global automaker   to supply the next-generation Mono Vision System for vehicles in   Europe.
